page.title: 15Maritime history of Papa.
page.content: In March 1930 an unlucky Aberdeen based trawler the Bendoran ran aground on the Ve Skerries.All the crew was lost because the weather was too bad for any boat to reach them _ despite gallant efforts by the crew of the Smiling Morn.(At this time the nearest lifeboat was based in Orkney.) By 1933 a lifeboat (the KTJS) was based at Aith and she went to the aid of the Highcliffe in 1940 when she ran aground on Forewick Holm.All the crew was saved as was the crew of the Aberdeen trawler Juniper in 1967. In 1977 the Eleanor Viking,another Aberdeen based trawler ran aground on the Ve Skerries,all the men were saved by helicopter,while a Nimrod aircraft stood by to light up the area. If the technology of 1985 was around in the 30's maybe the men of the Bendoran would still be alive today.
